channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023080505
item.description:
Report E-2023080505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONVENIENCE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Cargo Tank was was in a construction zone. Shoulder was reduced to 2.5 feet. Left side of vehicle left the pavement and in the drivers attempt of return to the paved surface the trailer "tripped" initiating the a 3/4 rollover. The tractor and cargo tank came to rest on its drivers side. The leakage was from the normal vent for compartment #1. The leakage continue until compartment #1's contents were transloaded during the recovery (approximately 3 hours). The total leakage was 30 gallons which was contained. All contaminated soil was removed and DNR testing has been conducted and submitted.
